items.title: Zohran Mamdani faces a daunting task: making his campaign pledges a reality
items.standfirst: The democratic socialist promised free childcare and buses and a rent freeze – can he deliver before New Yorkers lose patience?After more than a year of repeating ambitious promises about freezing rent and making childcare free, Zohran Mamdani will wake on Wednesday with a daunting task ahead of him: make those things reality for New York City.The 34-year-old democratic socialist ran New York’s most ambitious mayoral campaign in years, attracting hundreds of thousands of supporters with bold promises to make the largest US city affordable. Continue reading...
items.content: The democratic socialist promised free childcare and buses and a rent freeze – can he deliver before New Yorkers lose patience?After more than a year of repeating ambitious promises about freezing rent and making childcare free, Zohran Mamdani will wake on Wednesday with a daunting task ahead of him: make those things reality for New York City.The 34-year-old democratic socialist ran New York’s most ambitious mayoral campaign in years, attracting hundreds of thousands of supporters with bold promises to make the largest US city affordable. Continue reading...

items.title: Here's what Mamdani's win could mean for Democrats nationwide
items.standfirst: A Democratic Socialists of America leader says New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani offers a "powerful way forward" for Democrats — but some moderates worry he'll hand the GOP "a pretty potent set of weapons" in next year's midterms.
items.content: A Democratic Socialists of America leader says New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani offers a "powerful way forward" for Democrats — but some moderates worry he'll hand the GOP "a pretty potent set of weapons" in next year's midterms.

items.title: Progressive Democrat Zohran Mamdani wins New York City mayoral race
items.standfirst: Zohran Mamdani, a 34-year-old state lawmaker and democratic socialist, was elected mayor of New York City on Tuesday, becoming the city’s first Muslim and first South Asian mayor — and its youngest in more than a century. His victory marks a landmark triumph for the Democratic Party’s progressive wing and caps a meteoric political rise.
items.content: Zohran Mamdani, a 34-year-old state lawmaker and democratic socialist, was elected mayor of New York City on Tuesday, becoming the city’s first Muslim and first South Asian mayor — and its youngest in more than a century. His victory marks a landmark triumph for the Democratic Party’s progressive wing and caps a meteoric political rise.

items.title: The legacy of Dick Cheney, polarizing US VP dead at 84
items.standfirst: FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Ian Reifowitz, Distinguished Professor of History, SUNY-Empire State University, about the legacy of Dick Cheney on the international stage and in the Republican party. The hard-charging conservative who became one of the most powerful and polarizing vice presidents in U.S. history and a leading advocate for the invasion of Iraq has died at the age of 84.
items.content: FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Ian Reifowitz, Distinguished Professor of History, SUNY-Empire State University, about the legacy of Dick Cheney on the international stage and in the Republican party. The hard-charging conservative who became one of the most powerful and polarizing vice presidents in U.S. history and a leading advocate for the invasion of Iraq has died at the age of 84.

items.title: The political legacy of Dick Cheney, former US vice president
items.standfirst: Dick Cheney, the 46th vice president of the United States under President George W. Bush, died at 84. He was a central figure behind the 'war on terror' and the US invasion of Iraq. With a political career spanning five decades, he reshaped the role of the vice presidency and left a lasting mark on American foreign and security policy. FRANCE 24’s Angela Diffley reviews his career and analyses the legacy of this influential and often controversial statesman.
items.content: Dick Cheney, the 46th vice president of the United States under President George W. Bush, died at 84. He was a central figure behind the 'war on terror' and the US invasion of Iraq. With a political career spanning five decades, he reshaped the role of the vice presidency and left a lasting mark on American foreign and security policy. FRANCE 24’s Angela Diffley reviews his career and analyses the legacy of this influential and often controversial statesman.

items.title: Dick Cheney, former US VP dies, aged 84
items.standfirst: Dick #Cheney, the hard-charging conservative who became one of the most powerful and polarising vice presidents in U.S. history has died at 84. He was the architect of the post-#911 "war on terror" and a leading advocate for the invasion of #Iraq.
items.content: Dick #Cheney, the hard-charging conservative who became one of the most powerful and polarising vice presidents in U.S. history has died at 84. He was the architect of the post-#911 "war on terror" and a leading advocate for the invasion of #Iraq.

items.title: At least four dead and 11 injured after UPS plane crashes near a Kentucky airport
items.standfirst: Aircraft erupted into fireball after takeoff at Louisville international airport, and officials say fatalities could riseA UPS cargo plane crashed shortly after take off, erupting into a massive fireball near the Louisville Muhammad Ali international airport in Kentucky, leaving at least four dead and 11 injured, authorities said. The state’s governor, Andy Beshear said he expects those numbers to grow.Flames from the crash ignited a string of fires on the ground in an industrial corridor adjacent to the international airport, apparently accounting for one of the confirmed fatalities and the injuries of 11 people, who according to airport officials were taken to hospital. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The number of people who are out of work for health reasons has grown by 800,000 since 2019.
items.content: The number of people who are out of work for health reasons has grown by 800,000 since 2019.

The crisis is due to an £85 billion sickness bill.
The number of sick and disabled people out of work is rising.
There are 800,000 more people out of work than in 2019.
This situation threatens the country's economic prosperity.

clusters.title: Iran releases two French nationals from detention
clusters.neutral_headline: Iran releases two French nationals from detention

items.title: Iran releases two French nationals from detention
items.standfirst: Cécile Kohler and Jacques Paris are thought to have been the last French people held in Iran.
items.content: Cécile Kohler and Jacques Paris are thought to have been the last French people held in Iran.

items.title: Iran frees two French nationals from prison, Macron says
items.standfirst: Iran has released two French nationals imprisoned there for more than three years, French President Emmanuel Macron said on Tuesday, in apparent exchange for an Iranian student who was conditionally freed in October. Cecile Kohler and her partner Jacques Paris, who had been detained since 2022, "are out of the Evin jail and en route to the French Embassy in Tehran", Macron posted on X. FRANCE 24's Saeed Azimi reports from Tehran.
items.content: Iran has released two French nationals imprisoned there for more than three years, French President Emmanuel Macron said on Tuesday, in apparent exchange for an Iranian student who was conditionally freed in October. Cecile Kohler and her partner Jacques Paris, who had been detained since 2022, "are out of the Evin jail and en route to the French Embassy in Tehran", Macron posted on X. FRANCE 24's Saeed Azimi reports from Tehran.

items.title: Two French nationals freed from Iranian prison after more than 3 years in detention
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron said Tuesday that two French nationals have been released from an Iranian prison after more than 3 years in detention and were on their way to the French Embassy in Tehran.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron said Tuesday that two French nationals have been released from an Iranian prison after more than 3 years in detention and were on their way to the French Embassy in Tehran.

items.title: Two French nationals held for three years in Iran have been released, Macron says
items.standfirst: French citizens Cécile Kohler and Jacques Paris who were jailed in Iran for more than three years on espionage charges have been released, President Emmanuel Macron announced Tuesday.
items.content: French citizens Cécile Kohler and Jacques Paris who were jailed in Iran for more than three years on espionage charges have been released, President Emmanuel Macron announced Tuesday.

ai_summary: Iran released two French nationals, Cécile Kohler and Jacques Paris.
The French nationals were imprisoned for over three years.
They were en route to the French Embassy in Tehran.
The release was announced by French President Emmanuel Macron.
The release may be in exchange for an Iranian student.

items.title: Sequoia’s Botha Hands Stewardship of VC Firm to Lin, Grady
items.standfirst: Sequoia Capital managing partner Roelof Botha said he’s stepping back from his leadership role, and has named partners Alfred Lin and Pat Grady as the new stewards of one of Silicon Valley’s top venture capital firms.

Alfred Lin and Pat Grady will take over leadership roles.

items.title: Hamas hands over remains of a deceased hostage to Red Cross in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israel’s military said Tuesday that the remains of a deceased hostage had been handed over by Hamas to the Red Cross in Gaza, the latest transfer since a ceasefire took effect last month.
items.content: Israel’s military said Tuesday that the remains of a deceased hostage had been handed over by Hamas to the Red Cross in Gaza, the latest transfer since a ceasefire took effect last month.

items.title: Israel and Hamas hand over bodies as part of Gaza ceasefire deal
items.standfirst: Hamas hands remains of three soldiers to Israel and bodies of 45 Palestinians are returned to Gaza amid fragile ceasefireIsrael has announced that the remains of three soldiers killed by Hamas during its raid into Israel on 7 October 2023 have been handed over by the militant group.The transfer is the latest since the precarious ceasefire in Gaza came into effect just over three weeks ago. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Hamas handed over the remains of a deceased hostage to the Red Cross.
The transfer occurred in Gaza, according to Israel's military.
The transfer is part of the ongoing ceasefire deal.
Hamas also handed over the remains of three soldiers to Israel.
The bodies of 45 Palestinians were returned to Gaza.

clusters.title: Curfew lifted in Tanzania's main city after election unrest
clusters.neutral_headline: Curfew Lifted in Tanzania's Main City

items.title: Curfew lifted in Tanzania's main city after election unrest
items.standfirst: Families continue to search for or bury relatives, a day after President Samia Suluhu Hassan was sworn in.
items.content: Families continue to search for or bury relatives, a day after President Samia Suluhu Hassan was sworn in.

items.title: How Tanzania’s President Samia Suluhu Hassan went from reform to repression
items.standfirst: Samia Suluhu Hassan was sworn in as Tanzania’s president on Monday after winning an election in which her main rivals had been prevented from running. Once seen as a new democratic hope after first rising to the presidency in 2021, Hassan now stands accused of being at the head of a repressive regime that has violently suppressed historic protests.
items.content: Samia Suluhu Hassan was sworn in as Tanzania’s president on Monday after winning an election in which her main rivals had been prevented from running. Once seen as a new democratic hope after first rising to the presidency in 2021, Hassan now stands accused of being at the head of a repressive regime that has violently suppressed historic protests.

ai_summary: A curfew was lifted in Tanzania's main city after election unrest.
Families continue to search for or bury relatives.
Samia Suluhu Hassan was sworn in as president.
Hassan won an election where rivals were prevented from running.
She is accused of heading a repressive regime.

items.content: Rescuers located two bodies and are searching for the remaining five, believed to have been buried by snow.

items.title: Avalanche survivor 'was lucky' as rescuers search for bodies of dead climbers
items.standfirst: A French climber has said she was "lucky" to survive an avalanche in which her husband died, as rescue teams work to recover the bodies of seven people killed in the Himalayas on Monday morning.
items.content: A French climber has said she was "lucky" to survive an avalanche in which her husband died, as rescue teams work to recover the bodies of seven people killed in the Himalayas on Monday morning.

ai_summary: Seven climbers died in an avalanche in Nepal.
Rescuers have located two bodies.
They are searching for the remaining five bodies.
A French climber survived the avalanche.
The avalanche occurred in the Himalayas.

clusters.title: Powerful Afghan earthquake leaves at least 20 dead and hundreds injured
clusters.neutral_headline: Afghan Earthquake Kills at Least 20

items.title: Powerful Afghan earthquake leaves at least 20 dead and hundreds injured
items.standfirst: Northern provinces of Balkh and Samangan worst hit by magnitude 6.3 quake, which also damaged Mazar-i-Sharif’s Blue MosqueA powerful 6.3 magnitude earthquake shook northern Afghanistan before dawn on Monday, killing at least 20 people and injuring more than 640 others, 25 critically, a disaster management official said. Health officials said the numbers could rise.The US Geological Survey said the quake’s epicentre was located 22km (14 miles) south-west of the town of Khulm, and that it struck at 12.59am at a depth of 28km (17 miles). Continue reading...
items.content: Northern provinces of Balkh and Samangan worst hit by magnitude 6.3 quake, which also damaged Mazar-i-Sharif’s Blue MosqueA powerful 6.3 magnitude earthquake shook northern Afghanistan before dawn on Monday, killing at least 20 people and injuring more than 640 others, 25 critically, a disaster management official said. Health officials said the numbers could rise.The US Geological Survey said the quake’s epicentre was located 22km (14 miles) south-west of the town of Khulm, and that it struck at 12.59am at a depth of 28km (17 miles). Continue reading...

items.title: Powerful earthquake kills at least 20 people in northern Afghanistan
items.standfirst: At least 20 people have been killed and hundreds more injured in Afghanistan after a 6.3-magnitude earthquake struck the northern part of the country early Monday, the ruling Taliban said.
items.content: At least 20 people have been killed and hundreds more injured in Afghanistan after a 6.3-magnitude earthquake struck the northern part of the country early Monday, the ruling Taliban said.

ai_summary: A 6.3 magnitude earthquake struck northern Afghanistan.
At least 20 people have died due to the earthquake.
Hundreds more have been injured in the disaster.
The earthquake's epicenter was southwest of Khulm.
The quake struck at a depth of 28 kilometers.
